alert.note: Alert for Caledonia; Eastern Addison; Eastern Chittenden; Eastern Rutland; Eastern Windsor; Essex; Lamoille; Orange; Washington; Western Addison; Western Rutland; Western Windsor (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 25 at 1:14PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...A line of strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Lamoille, Orange, southern Caledonia, southern Essex, central Addison, southeastern Chittenden, northeastern Rutland, northern Windsor and Washington Counties through 215 PM EDT... At 113 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a line of strong thunderstorms extending from Marshfield Village to near Goshen. Movement was southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Barre, Woodstock, Montpelier, Middlebury, St. Johnsbury, Braintree Hill, Bradford, Salisbury, Waterbury Village, Websterville, Pomfret, Hartland, Worcester, Middlesex, Marshfield, Cabot Village, Fairlee, Sharon, Washington and Ripton. This includes the following highways... Interstate 89 between mile markers 1 and 64. Interstate 91 between mile markers 60 and 61, between mile markers 64 and 71, near mile marker 73, between mile markers 75 and 91, between mile markers 94 and 113, near mile marker 120, and between mile markers 123 and 130. Interstate 93 between mile markers 1 and 4, and between mile markers 9 and 11. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Caledonia; Eastern Addison; Eastern Chittenden; Eastern Rutland; Eastern Windsor; Essex; Lamoille; Orange; Washington; Western Addison; Western Rutland; Western Windsor
